title: As a User, I want newly created affiliates added to the Club System Dates screen
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club has been reaffiliated
custom_steps:
WHEN the Reafilliation process is complete
AND new version of club has been created
AND previous version of the club has been end-dated
custom_expected:
THEN new version of the club should get added to the System Dates screen beginning in the year after the reaffiliation
 AND the old version of the club will be removed from that screen for any future years

title: As a Club, I want Covenants returned through the MJC API
custom_preconds:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Club+Feed+Requirements%3A+Major+League+Contracts#ClubFeedRequirements:MajorLeagueContracts-7.IncludethefollowingfieldsfromtheCovenantssection:
GIVEN a club user is logged in with correct API role to be able to run MJC API
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to "EBIS Link" screen from left nav
custom_expected:
THEN user should be able to query by PlayerID
AND user should be able to query by ContractID
AND user should be able to query by Last Changed Datestamp Range
AND fields listed on the linked wiki under Covenants section should be added to the API
AND data in the response must exactly match data on the UI in the Covenants section
AND response should be returned under 2 seconds

title: Central Tender ETL
custom_preconds: GIVEN the Central Tender ETL has been run
custom_steps: WHEN user views the Central Tender Utility for 2018 or any past year
custom_expected: THEN data should match EBIS1 for all fields on the utility (including Salary Info Modal)

title: As a BOC User, I want to run the Tender Listing Report from the Central Tender Widget
custom_preconds:
Wire:
http://30ac5x.axshare.com/#p=central_tender_widget
Report Layout: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Tender+Listing+Report+Layout
Report Details: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Tender+Listing+Report+Details
Grouping, Population, Logic, and Sorting: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=118463040
Prompts: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Tender+Listing+Report+Prompts
GIVEN a BOC user is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to the Central Tender Widget
custom_expected:
THEN there should be a Print button
AND the print button should also contain a custom League Filter with the following options:
   -- All Leagues [Default]
   -- American League
   -- National League
AND clicking Print should run the Tender Listing Report for the League specified in the prompt and the Tender Year chosen in the Widget's header filter

title: As a User, I want to Print the Tender Utility for a specific club
custom_preconds:
Report Layout: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Tender+Listing+Report+Layout
Report Details: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Tender+Listing+Report+Details
Grouping, Population, Logic, and Sorting: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=118463040
Prompts: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Tender+Listing+Report+Prompts
GIVEN a BOC or club user is logged in with permissions for the CT utility
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing the Central Tender Utility for a club
custom_expected:
THEN there should be a print button
AND the print button should give the option of exporting in PDF or Excel mode
AND this export will be auto-filtered to only show data for the Club that the button was pressed on

title: As a user I want to sort the Central Tender Utility in view mode
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club or BOC user is viewing the Central Tender Utility in view mode
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks on any table header on the utility
custom_expected: THEN system should sort the column(asc or desc by column value) and add the red sort icon (icon should follow global layout)

title: As a User, I want to Cancel an Employee Profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is in Employee Widget
custom_steps:
WHEN user opens an employee profile in Edit mode
AND user clicks on Cancel button
custom_expected:
THEN Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to cancel the changes they have made. 
AND If they confirm the cancellation and the form has not yet been saved in the system, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to their entry point. 
AND If they confirm the cancellation and the profile has been previously saved in the system, then the profile should be reloaded in view mode, with none of the edits that were made since the last save and up to the cancellation point reflected.
AND If they do not confirm the cancellation then the user will be returned to the form and no action will be taken.

Wire:
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=employee_profile

title: As a User, I want to see an Employee Profile for a former Professional Player
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is in Employee Widget
custom_steps: WHEN user opens an employee profile who was a former player
custom_expected:
THEN Clicking the employees name in the Employees widget will load the employees profile
AND Browser tab text should say "Profile - [Last Name], [Roster First]"
AND The profile will match the provided data discovery and wire-  If an employee was a former player, use player profile and the employee profile header
AND These players include anyone that has signed a player contract at some point
AND All appropriate player profile tabs should be present (History, Info, Contracts, Waivers & Trans, International, Draft & Scouting, Service, Stats)

Wire:
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=employee_profile_-_past_player

title: As a user I want to be able to view an existing Assign as 7th Coach transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in Employee Profile
AND Employee has an existing Assign as 7th Coach transaction
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks on Transaction on employee's History (or Advanced Search)
custom_expected:
THEN system will open the transaction in the same window.
AND The layout of the transaction will match the View mode of the provided wireframe.
AND Fields will match the provided data discovery.
AND Whenever the form is in view mode, the user will see a "Close" button on the form in grey.
AND Clicking "Close" will return the user to their entry point into the transaction.

Wireframe: 
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=assign_as_7th_coach

title: Assign as 7th Coach - Editor permissions
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC or Club admin account logs in
custom_steps: WHEN the user is in employee widget
custom_expected:
THEN they should have the following Editor permission
BOC users with a Editor permission can:
  -Can view and Print all employee transactions [Club and BOC] in all states for Employees.
  -Can create, delete, edit, e-sign and submit all employee transactions for Employees. 
  -Can Approve, Reject, Reverse and Suppress all Employee transactions.

Club users with a Editor permission can:
  -Club users with this role can view and print all minor league transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transactions. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved player currently belongs to.
  However, there are exceptions:
       1. No Transactions that are in Suppressed state
       2. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field
  -Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) minor league transactions including other club's Minor League transactions or BOC only transactions with the following exceptions:
       1. Cannot see BOC Notes field for any transaction
       2. Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the player involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org
       3. Can create, delete, submit, edit, attach files, and e-sign all Minor League transactions for Minor League players on their Org's roster or if they are the"From Org" or "To Org".

title: Assign as 7th Coach - Viewer Permissions
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC or Club viewer account logs in
custom_steps: WHEN the user is in employee widget
custom_expected:
THEN they should have the following Viewer permission
-BOC users with a Viewer permission can*:
  -- Can view and Print all employee transactions in all states but cannot make any changes or e-sign.
  --Can view all flags for all transactions and transaction attachments in all states.

-Club users with a Viewer permission can*:
  --Club users with this role can view and print all employee transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transaction. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved employee currently belongs to.

          However, there are exceptions:
                  1. No Transactions that are in Suppressed state
                  2. They cannot edit or change these transactions (Basic only)
                  3. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field
 
 -Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) employee transactions including other club's employee transactions or BOC only transactions with the following exceptions:
 
    1.  Cannot see BOC Notes field for any transaction
    2.  Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the employee involved is 
         currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
    3. Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to reverse an Assign as 7th Coach transaction
custom_preconds: GIVEN an Assign as 7th Coach transaction has been approved for a player
custom_steps: WHEN BOC user is on Assign as 7th Coach transaction in view or Edit mode
custom_expected:
THEN BOC Approvers see a "Reverse" button in grey when they are viewing a transaction (in view or edit mode) in the Approved state. 
AND Clicking "Reverse" will run all required field and formatting checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. On Submit rules are not run. 
AND Successful reverse notification will be displayed. 
AND The transaction status is updated to "Reversed"
AND Display reversed transaction in player history with â€œVoided:â€￾ in front of the transaction description. Example:â€￾ Voided: Selection to ML Rosterâ€￾

title: As a user I want to be prevented from creating an Assign as 7th Coach for someone who is not a currently Active Employee
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC or club user logged in with Employee Transaction Permissions
AND user is on an Employee Profile for employee who has one of the following Employee Roster Status:
  - Active
  - Suspended
  - Temporarily Inactive
  - Ineligible
  - Disqualified
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects "Assign as 7th Coach" on the employee Create New menu
custom_expected:
THEN system will check if the person has a current Employee Roster Status of:
   - Active 
   - Suspended
  - Temporarily Inactive
  - Ineligible
  - Disqualified
AND If not, then display a blocking message. See Messages #12.

See Error Message #12: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Employee+Transactions+-+Messages

title: As a BOC user I want approving an Assign as 7th Coach transaction to auto-create/approve a Remove as 7th Coach transaction for the current 7th Coach
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user initials an Assign as 7th Coach transaction
AND the org already has a 7th Coach assigned
custom_steps: When the Assign as 7th Coach transaction is moved to "Approved"
custom_expected:
Then the system should auto create and approve a Remove as 7th Coach transaction for the current 7th Coach. 
AND All on approve rules and updates should be run per the provided rules, just as if the transaction was manually created.

title: As a user I want to receive an error if I have back dated my placement date more than 10 days
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC or club user is logged in with Employee Transaction Permissions
AND Assignment date on an Assign as 7th Coach transaction is set more than 10 days prior to the current date
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on Submit or Approve
custom_expected:
THEN Clicking "Submit" or "Approve" (all places OnSubmit rules are fired) will check if the placement date is 10 or more days prior to the current date. If yes, display error. See Messages #2.

See Error Message #2: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Employee+Transactions+-+Messages

title: As a user I want to be able to view an existing Remove as 7th Coach transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC or club user is logged in with Employee Transaction Permissions
AND the user is in Employee Profile 
AND Employee has an existing Remove as 7th Coach transaction
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks on Transaction on employee's History (or Advanced Search)
custom_expected:
THEN system will open the transaction in the same window. 
AND The layout of the transaction will match the View mode of the provided wireframe.
AND Fields will match the provided data discovery.
AND Whenever the form is in view mode, the user will see a "Close" button on the form in grey. 
AND Clicking "Close" will return the user to their entry point into the transaction.

Wireframe: 
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=remove_as_7th_coach

title: Remove as 7th Coach - Editor permissions
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC or Club admin account logs in
custom_steps: WHEN the user is in employee widget
custom_expected:
THEN they should have the following Editor permission
BOC users with a Editor permission can*:
 - Can view and Print all employee transactions [Club and BOC] in all states for Employees.
 - Can create, delete, edit, e-sign and submit all employee transactions for Employees. 
 - Can Approve, Reject, Reverse and Suppress all Employee transactions.

Club users with a Editor permission can:
- Club users with this role can view and print all minor league transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transactions. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved player currently belongs to.
However, there are exceptions:
1. No Transactions that are in Suppressed state
2. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field
- Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) minor league transactions including other club's Minor League transactions or BOC only transactions with the following exceptions:
1. Cannot see BOC Notes field for any transaction
2. Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the player involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org
3. Can create, delete, submit, edit, attach files, and e-sign all Minor League transactions for Minor League players on their Org's roster or if they are the"From Org" or "To Org".

custom_expected:

BOC users with a Viewer permission can:
 - Can view and Print all employee transactions in all states but cannot make any changes or e-sign.
 - Can view all flags for all transactions and transaction attachments in all states.

Club users with a Viewer permission can:
 - Club users with this role can view and print all employee transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transaction. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved employee currently belongs to.
However, there are exceptions:
1. No Transactions that are in Suppressed state
2. They cannot edit or change these transactions (Basic only)
3. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field
 - Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) employee transactions including other club's employee transactions or BOC only transactions with the following exceptions:
1.  Cannot see BOC Notes field for any transaction
2. Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the employee involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
3. Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org

title: As a user I want to receive an error if I have future dated my placement date more than 1 day
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC or club user is logged in with Employee Transaction Permissions
AND Assignment date on an Assign as 7th Coach transaction is set 1 day after the current date
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks on Submit
custom_expected:
THEN system will check if the placement date is more than 1 day past the current date. If yes, display error. See Messages #18.

See Error Message #18: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Employee+Transactions+-+Messages

title: As a user I want to receive an error if I have back dated my placement date more than 10 days
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC or club user is logged in with Employee Transaction Permissions
AND Assignment date on Assign 7th Coach transaction is set 10 or more days prior to the current date
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks on Submit or Approve
custom_expected: THEN Clicking "Submit" or "Approve" (all places OnSubmit rules are fired) will check if the placement date is 10 or more days prior to the current date. If yes, display error. See Messages #2.

title: As a user I want to be able to view an existing Assign/Reassign Employee transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC or club user is logged in with Employee Transaction Permissions
AND the user is in Employee Profile
AND the Employee has an existing Assign/Reassign Employee transaction
custom_steps: WHEN clicks on the transaction on employee's History (or Advanced Search)
custom_expected:
THEN system will open the transaction in the same window.
AND The layout of the transaction will match the View mode of the provided wireframe.
AND Fields will match the provided data discovery.
AND Whenever the form is in view mode, the user will see a "Close" button on the form in grey.
AND Clicking "Close" will return the user to their entry point into the transaction.

Wireframe: 
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=assign_reassign_employee

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=120635456

custom_expected:

BOC users with a Viewer permission can:
 - Can view and Print all employee transactions [Club and BOC] in all states for Employees.
 - Can create, delete, edit, e-sign and submit all employee transactions for Employees. 
 - Can Approve, Reject, Reverse and Suppress all Employee transactions.

Club users with a Viewer permission can:
 - Club users with this role can view and print all minor league transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transactions. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved player currently belongs to.
However, there are exceptions:
1. No Transactions that are in Suppressed state
2. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field
- Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) minor league transactions including other club's Minor League transactions or BOC only transactions with the following exceptions:
  1. Cannot see BOC Notes field for any transaction
  2. Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the player involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org
  3. Can create, delete, submit, edit, attach files, and e-sign all Minor League transactions for Minor League players on their Org's roster or if they are the"From Org" or "To Org".

custom_steps: WHEN the user is in employee widget
custom_expected:
THEN they should have the following Viewer permission
BOC users with a Viewer permission can*:
 - Can view and Print all employee transactions in all states but cannot make any changes or e-sign.
 - Can view all flags for all transactions and transaction attachments in all states.

Club users with a Viewer permission can:
  - Club users with this role can view and print all employee transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transaction. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved employee currently belongs to.
However, there are exceptions:

2. They cannot edit or change these transactions (Basic only)
3. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field
 - Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) employee transactions including other club's employee transactions or BOC only transactions with the following exceptions:

2. Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the employee involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org

title: As a user I want to be able to create a new Assign/Reassign transaction for a person
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC or club user logged in with Employee Transaction Permissions
AND the user is in Employee Profile
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks on "Create New" button on the Employee Profile
custom_expected:
THEN "Employee Transactions" is an option in the top-level dropdown.
AND Selecting "Employee Transactions" will display a secondary and tertiary dropdown.
AND "Assignments" should be an option under the secondary dropdown. 
AND "Assign/Reassign Employee" should be an option in the third level dropdown when "Assignments" is selected.
AND Selecting "Assign/Reassign Employee" from the Create New will check to see if there is an existing Preliminary transaction of the same type for the same employee created within 10 days of the current date. 
AND If a preliminary already exists, the system will load the existing transaction in Edit Mode instead of opening a new transaction. 
OR If no preliminary transaction created within the last 10 days already exists, then the system will load a new Preliminary transaction in edit mode. 
AND Transaction should follow the wireframe and data discovery. 

*Note that the editable fields differ for BOC and Club and based on Employee status*

See Wireframe: 
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=assign_reassign_employee

title: As a user I want to be able to save a new Assign/Reassign Employee transaction for an employee
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC or club user is logged in with Employee Transaction Permissions 
AND the user is in the Employee Profile
custom_steps: WHEN the user opens a new Assign/Reassign Employee transaction in edit mode for an employee
custom_expected:
THEN A Save button will be available anytime the form is in edit mode.
AND Clicking Save will save the transaction and it's current values.
AND Transaction status will be set to "Preliminary" if this is the first time the transaction is being saved. Otherwise the transaction status will not change.
AND After a successful save the system will display a successful save blue notification.
AND Whenever the form is in edit mode, the user will see a "Cancel" button on the form in grey.
AND Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to cancel the changes they have made.
AND If they confirm the cancellation and the form has not yet been saved in the system, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction.
OR If they confirm the cancellation and the form has been previously saved in the system, then the form should be reloaded in the default mode (view/edit) for the current transaction state, with none of the edits that were made since the last save and up to the cancellation point reflected.
OR If they do not confirm the cancellation then the user will be returned to the form and no action will be taken.

title: As a user I want to be able to delete an Assign/Reassign Employee transaction for an employee
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC or club user is logged in with Employee Transaction Permissions 
AND the user is in the Employee Profile 
AND Employee has an existing Assign/Reassign Employee transaction
custom_steps: WHEN the users opens a new Assign/Reassign Employee transaction in edit mode for an employee in Preliminary or Rejected states
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see a "Delete" button on the form in grey, in either view or edit mode.
AND Clicking "Delete" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to delete the form from the system.
Title: Warning
Body: Are you sure you want to delete this [form]? ("Form" to be replaced with transaction type)
Hint: This is a permanent action that cannot be undone.
Buttons: Yes, No
AND If they confirm the deletion, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction.
OR If they do not confirm the deletion, then they should be returned to the form and no action should be taken.

title: As a Club user I want to be prevented from initiating an Assign/Reassign transaction for an employee that does not belong to my Club
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC or club user is logged in with Employee Transaction Permission and attempting to create Assign/Reassign transaction for an employee
AND Employee's Current Org is different from logged in club user's Org
custom_steps: WHEN the user select "Assign/Reassign Employee" on the Employee Create New menu
custom_expected:
THEN system will check the employee's Current Org against the Org of the initiating user. 
AND If the Org of the initiating user is BOC, then they should be allowed to create the transaction.
OR If the Org of the initiating user is not BOC or the Current Org of the employee, then display a blocking message. See Messages #1.

See Error Message #1: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Employee+Transactions+-+Messages

title: As a user I want to approve an Assign/Reassign Employee transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC approver is logged in 
AND an Assign/Reassign employee transaction has been submitted to the BOC 
AND transaction is in Preliminary, Submitted to BOC, or Rejected status
AND blue "Approve" button is available (in view or edit mode)
custom_steps: WHEN BOC approver clicks on "Approve"
custom_expected:
THAN Clicking "Approve" will run all required field, formatting, On Submit and On Approve rules checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. 
AND Once all rules have passed or been overridden, the transaction status is updated to "Approved"
AND If the item was in edit mode, it is reloaded in view mode. 
AND If applicable, the BOC approvals item is removed.
AND A successful blue notification is displayed that states the transaction was approved.
AND If applicable, update Player's Player History: Code =ASGEE Description = Assign/Reassign Employee as {Position} , From Org/Club fields in black font. 
AND All other "Approval" updates per the provided business rules.

title: As a user I want the approval of an assign/reassign transaction to convert a player into an employee, if relevant
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC approver is logged in 
AND an Assign/Reassign employee transaction of a player submitted to the BOC done via a professional player profile
custom_steps: WHEN the user click on "Approve" button
custom_expected:
THEN system should convert the player into an employee.  
AND The player's Roster Status should be maintained.

title: As a BOC user I want to reject an Assign/Reassign Employee transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an Assign/Reassign Employee transaction has been submitted to BOC
AND grey "Reject" button is available (in view or edit mode)
custom_steps: WHEN BOC user clicks "Reject"
custom_expected:
THEN BOC users with edit permissions see a "Reject" button in grey when they are viewing a transaction (in view or edit mode) in a Submitted to BOC state. 
AND Clicking "Reject" will run all required field, and formatting checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. 
AND The transaction status is updated to "Rejected"
AND If the item was in edit mode, it is reloaded in view mode. 
AND A successful blue notification is displayed that states the transaction was rejected.
AND The item is removed from the player's history. 
AND The Approvals item is removed for the BOC.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to supress an Assign/Reassign Employee transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an Assign/Reassign Employee transaction exists for a Employee
AND a user is logged in as a BOC
custom_steps: WHEN Assign/Reassign Employee transaction reaches a approved or Reverse status
custom_expected:
THEN users that have permission to suppress the form will see a "Reverse and Suppress" option on Approved transactions and a "Suppress" button on Reversed transactions, both in grey, in either view or edit mode. 
AND Clicking "Reverse and Suppress" will first reverse, and then suppress the transaction. Reverse is handled in a previous story so this story will only deal with the suppression. 
AND Clicking "Suppress" will suppress the transaction.
AND When a transaction is suppressed it will be hidden from the player's Player History, Searches (unless BOC user specifically searches suppressed transactions), and any other place where it is visible on UI.
AND Suppressing a transaction will also remove any notifications that were generated for the transaction prior to suppression.
AND A blue notification should be thrown saying "The transaction has been successfully suppressed"

title: As a Club user I want to receive a notification when an Assign/Reassign Employee is rejected, approved or reversed
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an Assign/Reassign Employee tx exists for a Employee
AND a user is logged in as a club
custom_steps: WHEN Assign/Reassign Employee tx reaches a rejected, approved or reversed status
custom_expected:
THEN a notification will appear on the notification clipboard
AND Initiating Club (or the Club that the player belongs to) will receive a notification when the transaction is updated to Approved. 
OR Initiating Club (or the Club that the player belongs to) will receive a notification when the transaction is updated to Rejected.
OR Initiating Club (or the Club that the player belongs to) will receive a notification when the transaction is updated to Reversed, unless the transaction is also Suppressed. 
AND "Description" will be a hyperlink.
AND Clicking on the description hyperlink of any of these notifications will open the transaction in view mode in the same window/tab. 
AND Player's name will be a hyperlink.
AND Clicking on the player's name hyperlink of any of these notifications will open the player's profile in view mode in the same window/tab on the Player History tab.

title: As a BOC Approver I want to receive an error if I'm attempting to approve a transaction with an assignment date after the current date
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC approver initiated an Assign/Reassign Employee Transaction
AND Assignment date on the Assign/Reassign Employee Transaction is set after the current date
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on Approve
custom_expected: THEN system will check if the current date is after the assignment date entered on the transaction. If yes, display an error. See Messages #9.

title: As a user I want to edit an existing Assign/Reassign Employee transaction
custom_preconds: GIVEN an Assign/Reassign Employee transaction exists for an employee
custom_steps: WHEN user opens the existing Assign/Reassign Employee transaction
custom_expected:
THEN an Edit button will be available anytime the form is in view mode if the viewing user has edit permissions for the form in its current state.
AND Clicking Edit will reload the form in edit mode, and a Save button will appear in place of the Edit button (no edit button displayed in edit mode).
AND In Preliminary, the Club and BOC users will be able to edit all portions displayed on the form. 
AND In states other than Preliminary, edit only gives clubs access to attach new files. Club cannot edit existing attachments or any other part of transaction.
AND BOC is able to edit all fields in all states except for Approved and Reversed transactions.
AND In Approved and Reversed transactions, edit only gives BOC access to attach new files or edit existing attachments. They can also update "Comments" and "BOC Notes" fields, but they cannot edit any other part of transaction unless specifically stated in data discovery.
AND  Clicking Save will always reload the form in View mode.


See Wireframe: 
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=assign_reassign_employee

title: As a Club user I want to be prevented from initiating an Assign/Reassign transaction for a person that is not a current Employee
custom_preconds:
GIVEN club user initiating an Assign/Reassign transaction for an employee with the following status
  - Active
  - Suspended
  - Temporarily Inactive
  - Disqualified
  - Ineligible
custom_steps: WHEN user selects "Assign/Reassign Employee" on the Employee Create New menu
custom_expected:
THEN system will check if the person has a current Employee Roster status of: 
  - Active
  - Suspended
  - Temporarily Inactive
  - Disqualified
  - Ineligible
AND If not, and the initiating user is a Club user, then display a blocking message. See Messages #17. 
AND If not, and the initiating user is a BOC user, proceed with the transaction.

title: As a user I want to receive an error if I have future dated my placement date more than 1 day
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user future dated the placement date more than 1 day on Assign/Reassign Employee transaction
custom_steps: WHEN Clicking "Submit" ONLY (not approve)
custom_expected: THEN system will check if the placement date is more than 1 day past the current date. If yes, display error. See Messages #18.

title: As a user I want to receive an error if I have back dated my placement date more than 10 days
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user back dated the placement date more than 10 days on Assign/Reassign Employee transaction
custom_steps: WHEN click "Submit" or "Approve"
custom_expected: THEN system will check if the placement date is 10 or more days prior to the current date. If yes, display error. See Messages #2.

title: As a user I want to be able to save a new Remove Employee from Org transaction for an employee
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC or club user is logged in with Employee Transaction Permissions 
AND the user is in the Employee Profile
custom_steps: WHEN user opens a new Remove Employee from Org transaction in edit mode for an employee
custom_expected:
THEN A Save button will be available anytime the form is in edit mode.
AND Clicking Save will save the transaction and it's current values.
AND Transaction status will be set to "Preliminary" if this is the first time the transaction is being saved. Otherwise the transaction status will not change.
AND After a successful save the system will display a successful save blue notification.
AND Whenever the form is in edit mode, the user will see a "Cancel" button on the form in grey.
AND Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to cancel the changes they have made.
AND If they confirm the cancellation and the form has not yet been saved in the system, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction.
OR If they confirm the cancellation and the form has been previously saved in the system, then the form should be reloaded in the default mode (view/edit) for the current transaction state, with none of the edits that were made since the last save and up to the cancellation point reflected.
OR If they do not confirm the cancellation then the user will be returned to the form and no action will be taken.

See Wireframe: 
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=remove_employee_from_org

title: As a user I want to be able to delete a Remove Employee from Org transaction for an employee
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC or Club user is logged in with Employee Transaction Permissions 
AND the user is in the Employee Profile 
AND Employee has an existing Remove Employee transaction
custom_steps: WHEN the user opens a new Remove Employee from Org transaction in edit mode for an employee in Preliminary or Rejected states
custom_expected:
THEN user should see a "Delete" button on the form in grey, in either view or edit mode.
AND Clicking "Delete" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to delete the form from the system.
Title: Warning
Body: Are you sure you want to delete this [form]? ("Form" to be replaced with transaction type)
Hint: This is a permanent action that cannot be undone.
Buttons: Yes, No
AND If they confirm the deletion, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction.
OR If they do not confirm the deletion, then they should be returned to the form and no action should be taken.

title: As a Club user I want to be prevented from initiating a Remove Employee from Org transaction for an employee that does not belong to my Club
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC or club user is logged in with Employee Transaction Permission and attempting to create a Remove Employee from Org transaction for an employee
AND Employee's Current Org is different from logged in club user's Org
AND the user is in Employee Profile
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects "Remove Employee from Org" on the Employee Create New menu
custom_expected:
THEN system should check the employee's Current Org against the Org of the initiating user. 
AND If the Org of the initiating user is BOC, then they should be allowed to create the transaction.
OR If the Org of the initiating user is not BOC or the Current Org of the employee, then display a blocking message. See Messages #1.

See Error Message #1: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Employee+Transactions+-+Messages

title: As a user I want to be prevented from initiating a Remove Employee from Org transaction for a person that is not an active employee
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC or club user is logged in with Employee Transaction Permissions 
AND user is on an Employee Profile for employee who has one of the following Employee Roster Status: 
- Active
- Suspended 
- Temporarily inactive 
- Ineligible 
- Disqualified
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects "Remove Employee from Org transaction" on the employee Create New menu
custom_expected:
THEN system will check if the employee has the Employee Roster Status of: 
- Active
- Suspended 
- Temporarily inactive 
- Ineligible 
- Disqualified 
AND If not, then display a blocking message. See Messages #12.

See Error Message #12: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Employee+Transactions+-+Messages

title: As a Club user I want to receive a notification when a Remove Employee from Org is rejected, approved or reversed
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club user is logged in with Employee Transaction Permissions
AND a Remove Employee from Org Transaction exists for an employee
custom_steps: WHEN Remove Employee from Org Transaction reaches a rejected, approved or reversed status
custom_expected:
THEN a notification will appear in the notification clipboard
AND Initiating Club (or the Club that the player belongs to) will receive a notification when the transaction is updated to Approved. 
OR Initiating Club (or the Club that the player belongs to) will receive a notification when the transaction is updated to Rejected.
OR Initiating Club (or the Club that the player belongs to) will receive a notification when the transaction is updated to Reversed, unless the transaction is also Suppressed. 
AND "Description" will be a hyperlink.
AND Clicking on the description hyperlink of any of these notifications will open the transaction in view mode in the same window/tab. 
AND Player's name will be a hyperlink.
AND Clicking on the player's name hyperlink of any of these notifications will open the player's profile in view mode in the same window/tab on the Player History tab.

title: As a user I want to receive an error if I'm attempting to approve a transaction with an assignment date after the current date
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC approver logged in
AND Assignment date on the Remove Employee from Org transaction is set after the current date
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks on "Approve"
custom_expected:
THEN system will check if the current date is after the assignment date entered on the transaction. If yes, display an error. See Messages #9.

See Error Message #9:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Employee+Transactions+-+Messages

title: As a user I want to receive an error if I have back dated my placement date more than 10 days
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC or club user is logged in with Employee Transaction Permissions
AND Assignment date on Remove Employee from Org transaction is set more than 10 days prior to the current date
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on Submit or Approve
custom_expected:
THEN Clicking "Submit" or "Approve" (all places OnSubmit rules are fired) will check if the placement date is 10 or more days prior to the current date. If yes, display error. See Messages #2.

See Error Message #2: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Employee+Transactions+-+Messages

title: Employee Roster Widget -  Permissions
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC or club user is logged in with Employee Transaction Permissions
custom_steps: WHEN the users clicks on Employees
custom_expected:
THEN Users with this permission will be able to navigate to and view the Employee Roster Widget
OR Users without this permission will not see the link to navigate to the Employees Dashboard tab

title: As a user I want to refresh the UEC to account for changes in the number of years included in a UEC
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permissions to create an Employee Contract 
AND user initiates an Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_steps: WHEN editing Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_expected:
THEN there will be a "Refresh" button available beneath the years fields. 
AND Clicking this button will update the contract to contain the entered number of years in the Compensation section, as well as in all of the dropdowns for Options, Salary Escalators and Incentive Bonuses. 
AND The screen can reload if necessary - but none of the information entered prior to hitting refresh should be lost UNLESS the user is removing years and information has been entered for one of the affected years. 
AND The screen should remain in edit mode.

Wireframe: 
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=info_and_general_layout

title: As a user I want to add an Options clause to a UEC
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permissions to create an Employee Contract 
AND user initiates an Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_steps: WHEN editing Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_expected:
THEN there will be an "Options" expandable section that appears below the "Info" section.
AND By default, this section is collapsed.
AND This section has a toggle that allows the user to include this section in the contract or not. 
AND If the toggle is set to "No", then the section is not expandable.
OR If the toggle is set to "Yes", then the section is expandable. 
AND Setting the toggle to "Yes" will automatically expand the section. 
AND Setting the toggle to "No" will automatically collapse the section. 
AND When the section is expanded, there is a "Language" field available, per the data discovery. 
AND When the section is expanded, if the "Option Years" value in the Info section is set to a number greater than 0 (and the contract has been appropriately refreshed), there is an "Add Clause" button present. 
AND Clicking "Add Clause" will add an Options clause to the contract. 
AND The format and fields should follow the wireframe and data discovery. 
AND The "Add Clause" button will remain available, and the user can continue to add options clauses to the contract by clicking it. 
AND Once a clause has been added, there is a trash can icon on the clause, that when clicked, removes the relevant clause from the Contract. 
AND  The clause number should always start at 1 and count up from there. Ex: OP1 would be the first clause, followed by OP2 and OP3. If OP2 is deleted, then OP3 would become OP2. 

Wireframe:
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=options

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to see on the withdrawal screen if a WCA is pending
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC or club admin
AND one or more players have a TRD waiver request that is eligible for Withdrawal (Claimed TRD waiver, Result Bulletin Sent, Current Date>=Withdrawal Period Expiration Date, Withdrawal Process Not yet executed)
AND one or more of these players already has a Waiver Claim assignment in a "Pending to Club" state
custom_steps: WHEN user views the withdrawal section of waivers screen
custom_expected: THEN the player's name should appear in red
